question: Raph Koster, Brad McQuaid, Mark Jacobs, Brian Green and J. Todd Coleman are influential in MMORPG design. What is MMORPG?
api_result: MMORPG stands for Massively Multiplayer Online Role-Playing Game. It is a genre of video games that combines elements of role-playing games (RPGs) with a large number of players interacting in a virtual world. In MMORPGs, players create characters and embark on quests, explore vast environments, engage in combat, and interact with other players in real-time. These games often feature persistent worlds that continue to evolve even when the player is not logged in, and they typically include social elements such as guilds, trading, and cooperative gameplay. Popular examples of MMORPGs include "World of Warcraft," "Final Fantasy XIV," and "The Elder Scrolls Online."
